    Function reference

    Trace

    Programmatically inspect, debug, and manipulate functions and methods

    ggtrace()
    Insert traces for delayed evaluation
    ggedit()
    Interactively edit the source code
    gguntrace()
    Remove any existing traces

    Helpers

    Helpers for ggtrace workflows

    get_method() ggbody() ggformals()
    Get ggproto methods
    is_traced()
    Check if a method is being traced

    Tracedumps

    Log and interact with the output of injected expressions

    last_ggtrace() set_last_ggtrace() clear_last_ggtrace()
    Retrieve the last tracedump created by ggtrace()
    global_ggtrace() set_global_ggtrace() clear_global_ggtrace() global_ggtrace_state() global_ggtrace_on() global_ggtrace_off()
    Retrieve all tracedumps created by ggtrace()

    Workflows (experimental; due for v0.5)

    These function takes a ggplot object and a ggproto method, tracing and triggering the method immediately without relying on side-effects. Most of these workflow functions wraps around the lower-level function with_ggtrace(), a functional complement to ggtrace()

    with_ggtrace()
    Apply a ggtrace call to a single ggplot object

    Inspect

    Inspect values from steps in the method’s execution for examination

    ggtrace_inspect_return()
    Inspect the return value of a method

    Capture

    Capture a snapshot of a method’s execution state for dynamic evaluation

    ggtrace_capture_fn()
    Capture a snapshot of a ggproto method as a pre-filled function
    ggtrace_capture_env()
    Capture a snapshot of a ggproto method's execution environment

    Modify

    Modify the method’s behavior as it is executed and return the graphical output

    ggtrace_modify_return()
    Modify the return value of a method

    One-offs

    Convenient shortcuts to common workflows without side effects

    ggdebugonce()
    Debugonce a ggproto method

    On this page
